discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Amazon Aurora is a relational database engine that is fully managed by AWS. It provides automated backups of data by default. Aurora automatically backs up your data to Amazon S3 and also continuously backs up your data to Amazon S3 in a transaction log called the "backtrack." This allows you to restore your database to a specific point in time or to roll back to a previous state.

Selected Answer: B
B: Amazon Aurora

Selected Answer: B
B is the answer.

Selected Answer: B
B: Amazon Aurora

Amazon Aurora provides automated backups of data by default. When you create an Aurora DB cluster, the service automatically creates one or more automated backups of the DB cluster, known as a "backup window". These backups are stored in Amazon S3 and are retained according to your specified retention period.
Amazon Aurora provides built-in security, continuous backups, serverless compute, up to 15 read replicas, automated multi-Region replication, and integrations with other AWS services.

Selected Answer: B
Automated backups are available

Selected Answer: B
https://aws.amazon.com/rds/aurora/

Selected Answer: A
Applying encryption options for the database is indeed a customer's responsibility when using Amazon RDS

Selected Answer: A
A. Apply encryption options for the database.

D.
you are not required to patch the underlying database engine software in Amazon RDS, but you can choose to perform minor version upgrades at your discretion. 
For A: You don't need to modify your database client applications to use encryption.

A.
According to the AWS shared responsibility model, applying encryption options for the database is the responsibility of the company, as it is related to securing the data.
Apply encryption options for the database.

Selected Answer: A
A. Apply encryption options for the database.

According to the AWS shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for the security of the cloud infrastructure, while customers are responsible for the security in the cloud, which includes securing their applications, data, and operating systems. Applying encryption options for the database is the responsibility of the company, as it is related to securing the data. The other options are the responsibility of AWS.

Selected Answer: A
A is the answer.

Selected Answer: A
A. Apply encryption options for the database.

According to the AWS shared responsibility model, customers are responsible for securing their data in the cloud and this includes applying encryption options for the database. AWS is responsible for securing the underlying infrastructure, such as the hardware, operating system, and network, as well as providing the tools to help customers secure their data.

B and C are not the company's responsibility because the infrastructure is provided and maintained by AWS.
D. Apply minor patches to the database is AWS responsibility as well.

A company is using Amazon RDS.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
Amazon EFS is a file storage service that provides a persistent file system for your EC2 instances. It requires a VPC to isolate your EFS file system from other resources in the AWS Cloud.
Amazon EC2 is a service that provides virtual machines that you can use to run your applications. It requires a VPC to isolate your EC2 instances from other resources in the AWS Cloud.

Selected Answer: BE
B. Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS)
E. Amazon EC2
Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) and Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) are AWS services that require the use of a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

Selected Answer: BE
agreed

The AWS services that will require the use of a VPC are:

E. Amazon EC2 - Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) is a web service that provides resizable compute capacity in the cloud. Instances of EC2 are launched in a VPC.

B. Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) - Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) provides a simple, scalable, fully managed elastic NFS file system that can be used with AWS Cloud services and on-premises resources. Amazon EFS is a regional service that supports VPCs.

comments.content:
chat gpt .
Yes, I apologize for the mistake earlier. Amazon S3 does not require the use of a VPC, but Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) and Amazon EC2 do. Thank you for pointing out the error.

Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) and Amazon DynamoDB are AWS services that require the use of a VPC. Amazon S3, Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS), and Amazon Cognito can be used without a VPC.

Selected Answer: BE

Selected Answer: BE
B. Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS)
E. Amazon EC2

Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) and Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) are both services that will require the use of a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) when creating a new AWS account.
A VPC allows you to create a virtual network in the AWS cloud - no VPNs, hardware, or physical datacenters required - and to launch Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instances in a virtual network. Amazon Elastic File System (EFS) is a fully managed service that makes it easy to set up, scale, and manage file storage in the AWS Cloud.
